column4: Hi, I'm having some issues and I was wondering if anyone had some time to help, I'll explain...
I installed ubuntu 10.10 a while ago, alongside windows vista, and everything was going fine, but I didn't use it for a while, I left the PC at my girlfriends for a while
reinstall
and she thought it would be a good idea to just delete the partition ubuntu was on from within windows manager thing
now the computer starts and says "grub recovery"
and cannot find a filesystem
youll need to reinstall ubuntu which will redo grub
Allright, sorry
I reinstalled ubuntu 10.10 and even tried kubuntu 11.04
grub is on but has nothing to boot
and still got grub recovery
is there any way to default back to windows' old MBR? I only ever use ubuntu on a live CD
I have windows vista x64 home premium, but it doesn't have my raid drivers
would it even fix an MBR issue? I attempted "repair" with a win7 dvd
and it did nothing
Is there a way to uninstall grub? and would that default me to just windows?
I did reinstall ubuntu and even tried kubuntu on the same drive, but it still took me to grub recovery
The computer was running fine in windows when I got there, I restarted and I got the grub errors. Live CD finds the HD and all the windows file just fine.
And win 7 install dvd says there's vista on that partition.
Would I be able to use an ubuntu 10.10 live cd to burn an ISO? (As in, are there programs to do that within the live CD? Because I've no internet on the machine)
if you have a 2nd cd drive
I'm booting the livecd from USB
yes you can then
